meanings.sent1: The doctor quickly attended to the fainter in the waiting room.
meanings.sent2: The fainter was gently laid down on the sofa to recover.
meanings.sent3: The fainter woke up to find concerned faces peering down at them.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the fainter's collapse added a dramatic twist to the scene.
meanings.sent5: The fainter's sudden fall made everyone gasp in shock.

meanings.definition: Having a tendency to lose consciousness.
meanings.sent1: She felt fainter as the heat of the day wore on.
meanings.sent2: The patient's fainter spells worried the doctor.
meanings.sent3: The fainter kitten napped peacefully in the sunbeam.
meanings.sent4: The fainter light of the evening signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent5: His voice grew fainter as he moved further away from us.

meanings.sent1: The distant mountains appeared fainter as the fog rolled in.
meanings.sent2: The details in the painting became fainter over time.
meanings.sent3: The fainter sound of the music drifted through the open window.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of the event grew fainter as the years passed.
meanings.sent5: The fainter colors of the sunset painted the sky in pastel hues.
